com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget
Class TabPanel<T extends TabItem>

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.Component
              com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.BoxComponent
                  com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.AbstractContainer<T>
                      com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.TabPanel<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
SelectionProvider, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener
public class TabPanel<T extends TabItem>
extends AbstractContainer<T>
implements SelectionProvider

A basic tab container.

When using a tab panel as a selection provider the model element for each tab item should be set as the item's data Component.setData(Object).

Events:
BeforeSelect : TabPanelEvent(tabPanel, item)
Fires after an item is selected. Listeners can set the doit field to false to cancel the action.
  • tabPanel : this
  • item : the item about to be selected.
Select : TabPanelEvent(tabPanel, item)
Fires after a item is selected.
  • tabPanel : this
  • item : the item that was selected
BeforeAdd : TabPanelEvent(tabPanel, item, index)
Fires before a item is added or inserted. Listeners can set the doit field to false to cancel the action.
  • tabPanel : this
  • item : the item being added
  • index : the index at which the item will be added
BeforeRemove : TabPanelEvent(tabPanel, item)
Fires before a item is removed. Listeners can set the doit field to false to cancel the action.
  • tabPanel : this
  • item : the item being removed
Add : TabPanelEvent(tabPanel, item, index)
Fires after a item has been added or inserted.
  • tabPanel : this
  • item : the item that was added
  • index : the index at which the item will be added
Remove : TabPanelEvent(tabPanel, item)
Fires after a item has been removed.
  • tabPanel : this
  • item : the item being removed


 TabPanel panel = new TabPanel();
 panel.resizeTabs = true;
 panel.enableTabScroll = true;
 panel.animScroll = true;

 TabItem item = new TabItem();
 item.closable = true;
 item.setText("Tab Item");

 item.setLayout(new FitLayout());
 item.add(new Label("Test Content"));

 panel.add(item);

Field Detail

itemTemplate

public static Template itemTemplate
Default tab item template.

animScroll

public boolean animScroll
True to animate tab scrolling so that hidden tabs slide smoothly into view (defaults to true). Only applies when enableTabScroll = true.

bodyBorder

public boolean bodyBorder
True to display an interior border on the body element of the panel, false to hide it (defaults to true).

border

public boolean border
True to display a border around the tabs (defaults to true).

enableTabScroll

public boolean enableTabScroll
True to enable scrolling to tabs that may be invisible due to overflowing the overall TabPanel width. Only available with tabs on top. (defaults to false).

minTabWidth

public int minTabWidth
The minimum width in pixels for each tab when resizeTabs = true (defaults to 30).

resizeTabs

public boolean resizeTabs
True to automatically resize each tab so that the tabs will completely fill the tab strip (defaults to false). Setting this to true may cause specific widths that might be set per tab to be overridden in order to fit them all into view (although minTabWidth will always be honored).

scrollDuration

public int scrollDuration
The number of milliseconds that each scroll animation should last (defaults to 150).

scrollIncrement

public int scrollIncrement
The number of pixels to scroll each time a tab scroll button is pressed (defaults to 100, or if resizeTabs = true, the calculated tab width). Only applies when enableTabScroll = true.

tabMargin

public int tabMargin
The number of pixels of space to calculate into the sizing and scrolling of tabs (defaults to 2).

tabPosition

public TabPanel.TabPosition tabPosition
The position where the tab strip should be rendered (defaults to TOP). The only other supported value is BOTTOM. Note that tab scrolling is only supported for position TOP.

tabWidth

public int tabWidth
The initial width in pixels of each new tab (defaults to 120).

autoSelect

public boolean autoSelect
True to have the first item selected when the panel is displayed for the first time if there is not selection (defaults to true)..
